lines.text: Hey, Gramps. I'll have a choc malt, heavy on the choc, plenty of milk, four spoons of malt, two scoops of vanilla ice cream, one mixed and one floating.

[Sardonically]
Would you like to come in Wednesday for a fitting? Thank you.
Hey you! Do you have to make so much noise playing "Silent Night"?

[Looking at her picture on the wall]
You've a lovely family, Millicent. It could have been my family if you hadn't been so darn obstinate!
I'm Smith. John Smith.
Are you the John Smith who was in love with Pocahontas?
What, do I look 300 years old? Don't answer that.
What's this? One... two... eight! You're supposed to smoke one cigar a day.
I'm six months ahead of schedule.

[Dancing]
C'mon, gramps! Shake a leg!
If I shake a leg, young, lady, it'll be against your derriere.

[to Fuller, his patient]
Don't eat ruffage, don't drink liquor, don't smoke and don't worry. You'll outlive all your aunts whoever they are.
I have a feeling you're going to be a captivating creature.
Is that good or bad?
Good for you but bad for the boys.

[to his daughter]
Roberta, there is no disgrace in being poor. Remember that.
That's about the only good thing you can say about it.
My bootlegger says this is real bathtub gin.

[Sourly]
He must have been taking a bath when he made it.

[to her dog Penny]
Gee, you're getting fat.
Why shouldn't he? He eats everything and anything, including two of my trousers and three of my best shirts.
That's what I like about you, Millie. You've got such a great sense of humor.
She has to have or she wouldn't go out with you.
Quiet, brat!

[Coming down the stairs for their date]
Hello, Carl.
Hot diggity, Millie. You're the cat's meow!

[to Dan]
Oh, that'll be the cat's pajamas!

[to Millie]
I get the heebie jeebies when I think of him telling everybody you're his Sheba.
It's not money that makes you happy. It's what you do with what you have.
